39377685.review: Brillant! I like that you used this platform to tell yours and your country's story. I loved the pop-up videos. I felt the suspense when trying to escape. The music really made the suspense. In  today's age so many fantasy rpg's look alike. I find it very talented that you and your team were able to recreate the setting of Syria and give your rpg a different look. Anxiously awaiting part 2! :)

39255538.review: a wonderful little story ,comedic and tragic at the same time ,insane yet realistic , the way of mixing gameplay and commentary to tell the story is simple yet excellently made ,definitely worth playing and I hope to see more from the developers in the future.

38994740.review:
ich mag das spiel sehr und hoffe das die fortzetzung bald kommt.
Das spiel ist ein mal etwas anderes rpg.

38844224.review: Good job. Make this a full game and try to tell everything as detailed as possible. People need to be educated on this subject.

38599314.review: This game is a really creative way to make his (the creators') story more relatable through building on emotions and atmosphere. The video-commentaries add a next-level perspective to the game. Great Job, would like to see the next episodes of his story!

38567767.review:
This game represents a good way of getting the story of a Syrian refugee up close. Playing his situation while having him comment on his own story is actually quite innovative.

Don't expect great graphics or great game mechanics. This game is thumbs up for the story and the way it is presented.

38433179.review:
Tolles persönliches Spiel. Kurzweilig und charmant. Abdullah Karam ist sehr sympathisch und bringt seine Fluchterfahrung aus Syrien einem eindrucksvoll nah. 
Leider hat der 1. Teil nur eine knappe Spielzeit, aber die Geschichte wäre ausbaufähig.

38391264.review: I've only played about 5 minutes of it (actually 17mins because I had to restart the game because I had no idea what to do) but I caan already see it's out standing. It's got a real world vibe to it yet so pixelated similar to undertale. From what I've seen (like one environment) It's got out standing art style and great story. Would recommend to everyone.

38375754.review: На один раз, не тратьте время.

38330004.review:
Pretty nice game! I think the handsome man in the corner/ the guy we play has to be a very brave person and I feel honoured, that we can go through his story with him. This game shows the side of the war in Syria, nobody saw. We all know abaout the war through the TV or News, but we never expierend the things a refugee has expirienced. 
I enjoyed to blay it, but in the same time i feel bad abaout it. About the situation and everything. 
Tu sum it up: damn good game! Can't wait for Chapter 2. I would Rrcommand it 100%

38309986.review: Very thought provoking, definitely well worth playing.

38289881.review:
So:
+nice game
+Good stealth element
+Great art style
+Great story (so far)
+Light hearted yet deep (I felt the pain)

-Could use more stuff to read and more fleshing the culture 
-Authors head popping up breaks the immersion would be better if I could just read it 
-Kid could use a little kick in his step (too slow)
-No camels (audience pleasing is number one rule)

I wholeheartedly recommend this game.

38214009.review:
Very good but short game. Everything is correct, the music, the graphics. 
I can point two problems :


1)Remember the dialog because if you swipe them, you'll be like "what the fuck i need to do". But since the area are pretty smalls, you are not lost for more than 6-7 minutes.

38089886.review: Assad and his apparatus must answer for their crimes. He put thousands of Syrian teenagers into the real warfare (or under real torture) instead of just letting them play videogames.

38058011.review:
Path out is revealing and interesting. I really like the RPGM style packed into a topic like this. 
The video lay overs are giving it the extra touch too.

Its a short free experience i wouldnt want to miss if youre interested in the topic, youll learn something
for sure.

38003934.review: You're (Abdullah) really lucky to survive the war. Can't wait for episode 2, but will it cost anything?
38003934.developer_response: We will most likely charge a very modest amount of money for the next episodes, but this very much depends on the funding solutions we are currently working on. Stay tuned!

37983305.review: Great game. Having a lil video of the dude himself giving commentary was a nice touch. This game makes you realise more about whats going on over there and the comedy made it less heavy. I think you should try it out. It's not too long.

37968549.review: Una historia interesante de tomar en cuenta, con una duracion de no mas de 1 hora lo recomiendo si buscas "escuchar" una vivencia personal de alguien que solo esta queriendo compartir su historia con la gente

37946183.review:
Simple game but it breaks my heart knowing what kind of life is there on Syria. 
This is also an eye-opening.

37919704.review: This was an interesting game to play through. I thought the video cut-ins were a clever way to make this more than just a game. (Gamactivism? Gameducation? XD) Anyhow, it really brought the story home. As just a game, it was a bit linear. But, I did enjoy playing through it and would definitely check out the next installment.

37907528.review: Cute pixel art and decent story so far. I wish it had gone a little bit more in depth but I suppose than can happen in future chapters. I will be keeping an eye on this game.

37718801.review: Maravilloso, no hay otra forma de describirlo. Realmente me hizo sentir la historia. Los comentarios en video que añadieron son un muy buen detalle, me alegro de haber jugado este juego y espero que muchas personas más lo jueguen.

37595408.review: A truly immersive experience. I was on the edge of my seat - despite it being simple and mostly story driven, the fact that it is based on a true story kept sending shivers down my back. It also made me laugh out loud a few times. The Soundtrack is great as well and I can't wait for the next chapter. - Very recommendable!

37237472.review:
My feelings.....they hurt......
Nice and different kind of storytelling.
Good sence of humor.
Glad you made it Abdullah. (Sorry for letting you die several times)

37168094.review: Geniale Idee, diese Geschichte in ein Spiel "umzuwandeln",die 30min haben sich mehr als ausgezahlt.

36667357.review: Awesome game! Amazing story and the fact that the guy talks more in depth about certain situations he went through makes it even better!

36605082.review: Great game! But next time I would like to see everything realistic as possible, not things that are fake. Maybe it's just me but when he had to leave and when he was in the forest I really felt sad and scared.

36563777.review: I enjoyed this game, and the story that was told along the way. I hope they continue with the game and story. I would like to see what happens next.

36543132.review:
Very cool game i can't wait for Chapter 2. When am I able to play Chapter 2 btw?

Greetings from Austria!

36529765.review:
I really like the game. It is not focused on entertaining or fun like most other games.
It focuses on how people have escape the warfare in their country.

36523183.review: I really enjoyed this game, has a very awsome environment and realistic one, can be played with a controller, keyboard or the mouse, so it has a plenty of ways to play it, the soundtrack is amazing and aswell as the the story, is very touching. If you like these kind of games, play this one =)

36522408.review:
This Game Was Very Good and I can't for Chapter 2!!!! :) 
If you guys wanna check out the series I made on it click here:  https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL5v-Xfkxf1fhPmN3CT7SnjV7FIe5EpsOV
I rate this an awesome game!!!

36508930.review:
This was pretty good. I hesitate to call it a walking sim with minor adventure game elements but it shows the region in such a grim and hostile light that it actually got me nervous to interact with NPCs since the first ones I interacted with gunned me down. And speaking of gunning me down, I was a bit apprehensive about the in game commentary but it was one of the best parts of the game, explaining what it was like going on this journey and just to clarify what really happen. (That part where you tried to get past that ISIS checkpoint was pretty good.)

The closest thing I can think that's a flaw would be the lack of a dash button or feature. The auto dash feature is in the options but it doesn't work. And when you continue this  story, I would like a bit more gameplay like in that checkpoint section where you have three solutions to get past the terrorists. 

But it's still a good but short adventure and I'm now interested in the rest of it.

36480658.review:
Very nice little game. The fact it is inspired by a true story, and that the author provides video comments on the situations you play, really help relate to the protagonist. In that regard, I found it more powerful than many big budget games, as I really cared about the character.

The art style is pretty and the music is nice too, with nice retro vibes. 

Pretty short game though, but strong enough to enlighten you on the subject it is inspired from. Would enjoy playing next episodes. Keep up the great work!

36480632.review: I think the story deeply affected me because I live in Turkey. The atmosphere, music and dialogues were very realistic and dramatic. There are millions of Syrian asylum seekers in our country. Life story of all of them are different. Their family is fighting each other. Politics are ruining people's lives! This is a very sad situation. I hope this situation gets better soon. I would like the second game to be paid to support the producer. (hopefully the second part will be in Turkey).

36476441.review: very patronizing... like you are some kind of idiot and this guy is a mastermind.  Too long to reload game

36466730.review: This game really is an eye-opener to how a Syrian refugee has to live through at times of war. Very insightful

36465929.review:
Es ist einfach das schlechteste Spiel, das ich gespielt habe. Wofür spricht er was? Ich will nicht dein Gesicht beim spielen anschauen.
Blöd!

36429335.review: I really do like this game. However, I am having troubles giving people items. Can anyone help?

36416330.review:
I like the game very much. The insights it gave me I found both shocking and fascinating. The game helped me to better understand what becoming a refugee and fleeing your country can be like. What strikes me most is how a normal life can so drastically change when the decision is made that it's best to flee the country now.

So far the game only tells a part of Abdullah's story. I hope Cause Creations can continue working on the game and add the other parts of the story. I would like to know how it goes on. So far, the game is short but well-done. Quite insightful.

36402819.review:
This game is not about entertainment, but rather about using video games as a medium to tell a story. The mini-commentaries add to the immersion and the autobiographical element generates real suspense as you're constantly reminded that the game you're playing is someone's life story. I strongly urge anyone who wants a fresh perspective to give this a try- it may not be that long or have that much gameplay to it, but it is clear that the people behind this game put in a lot of effort. (I love the entire soundtrack).

Is it a great game?  It's okay
Is it a great experience? For sure and definitely worthwhile

36393291.review:
Moving story. The commentary contributes a lot to the game, it helps you to understand the horrible things
so many people have to go through just to get moved from place to place and get rejected here in europe.

I love the music, it's sad but still beautiful in a way, it adds a lot to the atmosphere of the game.

Looking forward to the next parts!

36376666.review: Excellent work!  I'm glad to hear your ok.  The whole thing reminds me of Anne Frank trying to get out of that apartment or something along those lines....so surreal.   I really hope that happy days are there for you again.  Good Luck

36354700.review: For a free little game I really enjoyed it. The art was nice, I especially liked the soundtrack. One thing I would suggest you should work on is establishing a better atmosphere. Other than that I really enjoyed it.

36354168.review: Loved this game! It's short but very well-done. Love the autobiographical nature and the commentary. Very unique and special. I wll never forget it. Puts a more human face, so to speak, on the Syrian crisis.

36350662.review:
I enjoyed the game.
To bad it's not longer,
can't wait for chapter two.

36346597.review:
I found this game by looking randomly through the store, hoping to maybe find something good. 
And what i found was this! And it was something good!
It is short and simple made but takes you emotionally somewhere you dont be that often. 
I also liked the voice comments by that Syrian guy who is telling this story in this little game. 
Well made and a very nice game for in-between playing and something new you never played before,
defenetly worth a try.

36346259.review: I LOVE this story,, love from Palestine brother <3

36340501.review: i loved it! this definitly needs a chapter 2

36339179.review:
The game crash after you ran away home.
The game is laggy for me.

Its still good, I really like that someone is speaking as you play.
i was thrilled and scared that something bad might happen to him.
well, [spoiler]i was just very glad he survived[/spoiler]. even though i feel sad for him...


Edit:
thank you, I was able to finish the chapter by restarting the game each time the area change.
36339179.developer_response: Unfortunately, it is your ageing hardware, I fear. My apologies, the later maps use quite some resources, since they have been painted as a giant image instead of using a tile based system. Hopefully there will be a patch in the next months that can fix that, we also depend on external plugins that might increase the performance here, if they get updated.

36335848.review:
高清版。
玩着很舒服。

HD version.
It's very comfortable.

36334612.review: Amazing job! Path Out is very atmospheric game and I enjoyed it. There were a lot of information and feelings about Siria and 2014 that made the experience so interesting. Although it needs some graphics adjustments, the audio part was good and the video-voiceover is such a great idea. I would like to play more games like this, games which show the darkness of the world, telling real life stories in a game way. I am looking forward for chapter 2 of Path Out, or, any other games in a style like that.

36306503.review: Very interesting plot! Can't wait to try the next ep. The story and the actual comments of Abdullah are delivering a new experience to the players ;) Keep that good work up!

36303323.review: Its a good start to a game about a Syrian refugee and their journey out of Syria. Though movement is a bit slow and it doesnt instantly tell you where to go and how, with it only having two fetch quests and a bit of plot so far.

36293638.review: Definitely a game worth experiencing. That's what it is - an experience, and a good one at that. You stand in the shoes of a (very humorous and likable) Syrian refugee and get to play his "path out" from the war. Doesn't feel like other RPGs that way, much more "real" and btw made me understand a little bit better what was/is going on down there. It really made me think what I would be doing in his situation. Can't wait for chapter 2!

36286988.review: This is a really well done little game. The little pop-in videos are charming, and the game itself is simple but well made. A great insight into one story of Syria.

36285395.review: The commentary from this adventure game based off Abdullah story is really amazing looking forward to the rests of the parts especially considering this is quite challeging and scary as well.

36281985.review: A touching and emotional experience! And free, so what are you waiting for?!? PLAY IT!

36259846.review:
For such a simple game, this is quite intense. I'm grateful for Abdullah's running commentary within the game - it is as telling to hear him say, "Just so you know, I didn't do THAT" as it is to get no commentary at all for an action you've taken.

Thank you to Abdullah and the team at Causa for creating this. I really look forward to chapter 2.
